name: 9.17 "Wedding Bell Blues" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 9 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What song was Frasier singing after the opening credits?
options: I'll Never Ever Forget What's His Name
questions.explanation:
You're Just in Love.

	"You're Just in Love" was from the musical "Call Me Madam". The others at the bar were sick of hearing Frasier singing.

questions.text: Who took over on the karaoke machine?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	Bebe Neuwirth, who played Lilith, had a musical theatre background and a great voice. The creators capitalized on this by having her sing or dance in some of the episodes, including this one.

questions.text: Who was supposed to get married in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca & Rebecca Howe & Howe.

	In the previous episode Rebecca convinced Sam she didn't love Robin and did not want to marry him. In this episode, she entered the bar wearing her wedding dress ready to marry Robin.

Cliff.

	Lilith said that people don't usually deal with depression "by putting on a wedding dress and acting giddy". Carla replied, "Except Clavin". I find it amusing he commented on the getting giddy part and not the wearing a wedding dress part.

questions.text: When Rebecca said she needed "something old, something borrowed and something blue", what did Carla suggest?
questions.explanation:
Norm's liver.

	Norm responded, "I am almost finished with it." With all the beer Norm drank his liver was probably deteriorating.

questions.text: When Sam broke into Rebecca's house what did he grab?
questions.correct: pizza boxes, pink bathrobe, and wine bottles
options: fire poker, pants and Gatorade bottles
questions.explanation:
pizza boxes, pink bathrobe, and wine bottles.

	He was hoping this stuff would jog her memory. It took her a bit but she finally remembered.

questions.text: When Woody couldn't find the garter in Rebecca's car what did he bring instead?
questions.explanation:
jumper cables.

	Rebecca asked Woody if she was supposed "to throw a tire-iron to the brides maids". Woody left again to go and find one.

questions.text: What did Robin give to Rebecca for a wedding present?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Hatfield.

	Bobby Hatfield was one of the Righteous Brothers. Sadly, he died at the age of 63 in 2003 from a heart attack caused by a cocaine overdose. He died just hours before a concert he and the other Righteous Brother, Bill Medley, were to perform.

questions.text: What did Frasier say he'd give Robin and Rebecca as a wedding present?
questions.explanation:
a set of steak knives.

	He said that she could "cut out his heart again". Frasier was planning to sing at Rebecca's until Bobby Hatfield showed up.

questions.text: When the singer sang "We've Got Tonight", what did Rebecca do?
options: broke up with Robin on the spot
questions.explanation:
walked backward up the aisle.

	The song jogged her memory and she remembered she didn't love Robin anymore. She later told Robin she only loved him for his money and didn't really love him. She then found out he wasn't poor as she had thought. He had stored a $6 million money belt under the drawer of her office desk.
